comment:
* Holder type for a prepared statement.
     *
     * Although this object holds a pointer to a native statement object, it
     * does not have a finalizer.  This is deliberate.  The {@link SQLiteConnection}
     * owns the statement object and will take care of freeing it when needed.
     * In particular, closing the connection requires a guarantee of deterministic
     * resource disposal because all native statement objects must be freed before
     * the native database object can be closed.  So no finalizers here.

variables.name: mSql
variables.comment: The SQL from which the statement was prepared.

variables.name: mStatementPtr
variables.comment: Lifetime is managed explicitly by the connection.

variables.name: mNumParameters
variables.comment: The number of parameters that the prepared statement has.

variables.name: mReadOnly
variables.comment: True if the statement is read-only.

variables.name: mInCache
variables.comment: True if the statement is in the cache.

variables.name: mInUse
variables.comment: in use statements from being finalized until they are no longer in use.
